msItem.title: Medical recipes
msItem.note: Further medical recipes in Latin and German have been added in several contemporary hands (including the hand which made the index and list of contents) on the front pastedown, fol. i–iv (parchment flyleaf), 2–2v, 5–6, 205va–266va, 206v, 276v, 278 (end pastedown).

There is an original list of contents (numbered i–xvii) on the front pastedown, written in two hands, the first of which may be the scribe of the MS. There is an alphabetical index in the near contemporary hand which foliated the MS. (fol. 267–76, completed on fol. 3–4v) and a list of contents in the same hand, with the items numbered continuously up to cxlvij (beg. imperf. fol. 6v at no. xlv (fol. cxi), continued and completed on fol. 276–278).

supportDesc.support: paper, watermarks in main part of MS., a human head, cf. Briquet nos. 15600–3; spectacles, close to Briquet 10622 (last 3 quires only); watermark in the first, added quire (fol. 2–6) not clearly visible.
supportDesc.extent: 284 leaves (fol. 1, 32, 71, 78, 132, 163, 220 are double, fol. 1, ia, 277 are flyleaves, etc.), 297 210
supportDesc.foliation: fol. 7–266 are foliated i–cclxiiij in an almost contemporary hand.
supportDesc.collation: 1 original flyleaf, 1⁸ (6–8 canc.), 2¹²–24¹², 1 original flyleaf: a thin parchment strip reinforces the middle of each quire; quires 2–24 numbered 1–24 (the numbering skips from 22 to 24) in red in a contemporary hand in the centre of the upper margin of each first folio; (additions) Si autem; (text) Sequitur

handDesc.handNote: Written in Austria in the 15th cent, in a fine set cursive hand.

binding.p: Binding, late 15th cent, in puce dyed leather on bevelled wooden boards with corner bosses (2 missing); clasps on lower cover; lined tooling with triple fillets; plaited headbands. A small rectangular piece has been cut out of the upper cover.

history.provenance: Formerly no. 313 in the library of Admont abbey (see book stamp of the library on fol. 2; paper label on spine and 15th–cent. description pasted inside front cover).
Sold by Admont in or after 1934 to L. and A. Brecher of Brünn (Möser–Mersky, op. cit., p. 9).
Bought by Lyell in January 1941 from Davis and Orioli: see their Cat. 78 no. 2; 93 no. 53.
